To answer some of your questions...

> 1) Where do you start to build your base styles

I would recommend building your own... or consider using/contributing to the open source one <#CCQSQ2C6L|crankshaft>

> 2) What is the grid HubSpot uses based on? Is it Bootstrap or something else?

HubSpot's drag-and-drop editor relies on Bootstrap 2. You're able to use whatever framework you prefer using "Coded Templates", however, you may lose a little of the drag and drop functionality.

I feel community developers use 1/2 DND and 1/2 coded templates.... really depends on who the end user is of the pages.

Side note on CSS - You CAN use SASS/LESS/etc locally using the <#CLJJXGTC0|local-development>

> "3) Is there a "guide" to the css files HubSpot includes?"

Everything we have is in your CMS Dev Documentation: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs>

We do understand our docs need a facelift... (it's in the works)... so if you have any questions or ideas. Please let us know in <#C26E7JT8V|ideas> . You can ask questions about CSS in <#CFPGEKRJ7|templates> or <#CFPRTEGTX|modules> ... and anything on JS in <#CBA9UA4EN|javascript>

Luke,

Thank you for the information. I started coding my navigation and footer modules with the base brand styles and was so very happy to see the SAAS/Less for CSS.  This is a best practice I use outside of HubSpot and am happy to be able to continue it here.

The other question I have is in relation to common files and templates.  I feel like there needs to be a higher level "site template" that contains the css and js files needed for your site as a whole. It feels weird to me to have to associate base template files (main.css for example) to every template page.  It would be valuable to be able to set this once in a site template and be able to assign page templates to the site template to automatically acquire these files. Is there something in Settings that I have missed that will do this? Thanks so much for your time and insight.
There is a place in settings for a site wide CSS file under Website - Pages
Thanks .it's also a pleasure for me
